page.title: 13Employment in Cliffe
page.content: We asked the children in Cliffe school where their mothers and fathers worked. Two fathers were{unemployed, 36 fathers had jobs, and 19 mothers had jobs as well. There were 37 different jobs on the list. 13 people worked in the village, 5 on market gardens and 4 on farms. Three people each worked at power stations, banks, coal mines, British Oil and Cake Mills in Selby, or as lorry drivers. There were 29 jobs that only one person worked at, with some uncommon ones like silversmith, bobbin lace equipment supplier, carpet repairer and Australian Tourist Commission. Not many adults in Cliffe are unemployed, but it is harder for teenagers to get work.
